Also, various presently unforeseen or unanticipated alternatives, modifications, variations, or improvements therein may be subsequently made by those skilled in the art which are also intended to be encompassed by the description above and the following claims.

claim.claim-text: 1. A gypsum wallboard panel comprising:a. a gypsum core; andb. a paper cover sheet disposed on the gypsum core, the paper cover sheet comprising pulp fiber and an uncooked starch in an amount of at least 2% by weight of the pulp fiber.
2. The gypsum wallboard panel of claim 1, wherein the paper cover sheet is a multi-ply paper cover sheet, and wherein at least one of the plies includes the uncooked starch.

3. The gypsum wallboard panel of claim 2, wherein the multi-ply cover sheet includes at least one filler ply and at least one liner ply, and wherein at least one of the filler ply or the liner ply includes the uncooked starch.
4. The gypsum wallboard panel of claim 1, wherein the paper cover sheet comprises manila paper.

5. The gypsum wallboard panel of claim 1, wherein the gypsum core comprises a back side and a face side, and wherein the paper cover sheet at least partially covers the face side and/or the back side of the gypsum core.

6. The gypsum wallboard panel of claim 1, wherein the gypsum core comprises a back side and a face side, wherein the paper cover sheet at least partially covers the face side of the gypsum core, and wherein the gypsum wallboard panel further comprises an additional paper cover sheet at least partially covering the back side of the gypsum core.
7. The gypsum wallboard panel of claim 1, wherein the uncooked starch in the paper cover sheet is provided in an amount of at least 3% by weight of the pulp fiber.
8. The gypsum wallboard panel of claim 1, wherein the uncooked starch in the paper cover sheet is provided in an amount of at least 6% by weight of the pulp fiber.
9. The gypsum wallboard panel of claim 1, wherein the uncooked starch in the paper cover sheet is provided in an amount between 2% and 10% by weight of the pulp fiber.
10. The gypsum wallboard panel of claim 1, wherein the uncooked starch comprises one or more of an anionic starch, a cationic starch, or an uncharged starch.
11. The gypsum wallboard panel of claim 1, wherein the pulp fiber comprises hard stock or soft stock fiber.

12. The gypsum wallboard panel of claim 1, wherein the pulp fiber comprises one or more of Kraft paper, corrugated paper, cellulose fibers, waste newsprint, microfibrillated cellulose, or any combination thereof.

13. The gypsum wallboard panel of claim 1, wherein the wallboard panel has a nail pull resistance at least about 6 lbs greater than a nail pull resistance of an equivalent wallboard panel without the uncooked starch, and/or a reduced density of between 6 to 10 lbs per msf.

14. The gypsum wallboard panel of claim 1, wherein the wallboard panel has a tensile strength of at least 20%-40% greater than a tensile strength of an equivalent wallboard panel without the uncooked starch.

15. A multi-ply paper cover sheet comprising:a. a plurality of plies, at least one ply comprising:i. pulp fiber comprising one or more of hard stock or soft stock fiber; andii. an uncooked starch in an amount of at least 2% by weight of the pulp fiber.
16. The multi-ply cover sheet of claim 15, wherein the plurality of plies comprise at least one filler layer and at least one liner layer.
17. The multi-ply cover sheet of claim 15 wherein at least two of the plies comprise the pulp fiber and the uncooked starch.

18. The multi-ply cover sheet of claim 15, wherein the pulp fiber comprises one or more of Kraft paper, corrugated paper, cellulose fibers, waste newsprint, microfibrillated cellulose, or any combination thereof.

19. A composition for a paper cover sheet comprising:a. water;b. pulp fiber comprising one or more of hard stock or soft stock fiber; andc. An uncooked starch in an amount of at least 2% by weight of the pulp fiber.

20. The composition of claim 19, wherein the pulp fiber comprises one or more of Kraft paper, corrugated paper, cellulose fibers, waste newsprint, microfibrillated cellulose, or any combination thereof.

21. A method for making a paper cover sheet for a wallboard, the method comprising:a. preparing a composition comprising water and pulp fiber comprising one or more of hard stock or soft stock fiber;b. incorporating an uncooked starch in an amount of at least 2% by weight of the pulp fiber into the composition;c. forming at least one ply with the composition; andd. drying the at least one ply.
22. The method of claim 21, wherein said incorporating comprises combining the uncooked starch with the composition before said forming.
23. The method of claim 22, wherein said incorporating comprising mixing the uncooked starch with the composition in a liquid mixture.
24. The method of claim 21, wherein said incorporating comprises combining the uncooked starch with the composition after said forming.

25. The method of claim 24, wherein said incorporating comprises:a. combining the uncooked starch with water; andb. dispersing the combined uncooked starch and water onto the formed at least one ply to migrate through the formed at least one ply.

26. The method of claim 25, wherein the method further comprises preheating the uncooked starch in the combined uncooked starch and water to a temperature above ambient temperature and below a pregelatinization temperature of the uncooked starch to allow the water to penetrate starch granules of the uncooked starch.

27. A method of forming a wallboard panel comprising:a. preparing a paper cover sheet according to the method of claim 21;b. preparing a gypsum slurry comprising gypsum and water;c. forming a gypsum core layer over the prepared paper cover sheet;d. allowing the gypsum core layer to set; ande. drying the gypsum core layer.

28. The method of claim 27,a. wherein the prepared paper cover sheet is disposed in one or more paper rolls and fed to a conveyor belt; andb. wherein the gypsum core layer is formed by dispensing the gypsum slurry over the prepared paper cover sheet as it moves along the conveyor belt.
29. The method of claim 27, wherein the method further comprises:a. preparing an additional cover sheet; andb. covering the formed gypsum core layer with the prepared additional cover sheet.
30. The method of claim 29, wherein the prepared paper cover sheet comprises manila paper.
31. The method of claim 29, wherein the prepared additional paper cover sheet is other than manila paper.
32. A paper cover sheet prepared according to the method of claim 21.
33. A gypsum wallboard prepared according to the method of claim 27.
34. A paper cover sheet as described herein.
35. A gypsum panel as described herein.
